title: Oklahoma City National Memorial: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park                   See the memorial through photos and multimedia               The people impacted and their stories               Kids and youth activities               Educational oppurtunities               Learn how the memorial is managed         Â    Photos & Multimedia Explore the Memorial through photographs, videos, and podcasts. History & Culture The wealth of stories that surround the Memorial is awe inspiring. The 1995 bombing of the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building is a complex tale that deeply touched the country and the world. Education Visiting the Outdoor Symbolic Memorial and Museum assists learners in making a deeper connection to this event and the important place it holds in American history. Multiple ways to experience the Memorial are available, including scheduling a talk with a Park Ranger, touring the museum, and curriculum based lesson plans. Kids & Youth There are a wide variety of activates that are available for youth to participate in as they explore the Memorial and other National Park Sites. Management This unique site is a partnership between a community led non-profit Trust and the National Park Service.The two entities work together in order to communicate this important part of history with the world.
